Please permit me to welcome you to membership in the HAJ23 and to
assure you of our interest in making the full facilities of our organization
available to you in any way wherein we may be of service*
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters, now 28 years
old, has always been the voice of educ ational institutions and individuals
who are interested in utilising radio and television as an educational tool*
During the past several years the organization has Increased its activities
many times and its scope of influence* You are, no doubt, aware of the NAEB
Tape Network thereby many of the world’s finest programs are made available
for broadcasting on the educational stations throughout the country* This
activity has expanded from a three programs per week "bicycle" network to
direct service on approximately eight hours of programming per week. During
the past twelve months, through direct negotiations with countries of Western
Europe, we have increased the flow of cultural and informational programs
in both directions to a considerable extent and expect to expand our inter*
national exchange considerably during the current year*
Each year NAE3 conducts several seminars and workshops for the
upgrading of personnel and through a grants*in-aid program made possible
by the Fund for Adult Education has been able to contribute to the improve*
ment of programming on the local level to a significant extent* We hope
to continue to serve the needs of educational radio and television stations
and educational radio and television production groups increasingly in the
futmy’.
I trust that your membership in !JA£B will offer stimulating and
rewarding contacts, information, and services during the year ahead. Please
feel free to call upon me directly or upon our headquarters of fice fbr any
services we may be able to render.
Very sincerely yours.
